result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karl Lendus Kreidler

defendant.name: Kreidler, Karl Lendus
defendant.address: 9008 E Baldwin Av, Solon Springs, WI 54873

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:33 PM Defendant Karl Lendus Kreidler appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Hoffman.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Apartment 106. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Defendant indicates that he cannot read it because he does not have his glasses; Attorney Hoffman informs defendant of charges and possible penalties.
State requesting $2000sb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
State indicates dated criminal record.
Attorney has no objection.
Court orders $2000sb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
